titleStmt.title: A worthy speech spoken in Parliament, by Mr. Pym, concerning evill counsellors about his Maiestie. Also manifesting the particular advantages that would redound to his kingdome, if the said evill councellors were removed from about his majesty.
titleStmt.author: Pym, John, 1584-1643.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by T. F. for I. H.,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
